meanings.sent1: She stokes the campfire to keep it burning brightly.
meanings.sent2: He stokes the barbecue to make sure the charcoal is evenly heated.
meanings.sent3: The little girl stokes the fire with such enthusiasm, she almost singes her eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His words stokes the flames of passion in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith stokes the forge, sending sparks flying in all directions.

meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the liquid's stokes to determine its flow rate.
meanings.sent2: The stokes of the oil indicate how easily it flows through the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the most stokes in the fluid dynamics lab was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The stokes of the river determine how fast the water moves downstream.
meanings.sent5: The student learned about stokes in physics class and found it fascinating.

meanings.definition: A former British unit of kinematic viscosity, equal to 0.000645 square meters per second
meanings.sent1: The textbook explained the conversion of stokes to other units of viscosity.
meanings.sent2: The stokes measurement was commonly used in old British engineering calculations.
meanings.sent3: In the historical novel, the characters argued over the value of stokes in their experiments.
meanings.sent4: The ancient machinery required precise stokes to function efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed an old instrument used to measure stokes in the 19th century.
